_header: O lord of love hear my complaint
_description: A description of his mistress — five 8-line stanzas

BLCottVesDIX.First Lines: O lord of loue here my complayntAnd do me Ryght I the requere…
BLCottVesDIX.Last Lines: …And but she rewe me of me careIn to oreable ys here trespasse…
BLCottVesDIX.Note: Ends imperfectly at seventh line of an 8-line stanza.
BLCottVesDIX.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 122-4.
